content.description: Wow it's mossy, but there's just enough rock available to make this climbable. Center flakes on the uphill side of the slab face.
content.location: Directly uphill from Mineral Spirits. Opposite side of Fall Silent boulder.

content.description: Start with a right gaston on a small crimp feature out right and the left on the obvious sloper rail in the middle. Have fun figuring out the feet and make it up to the top. Do not use the large protruding boulder underneath for feet.
content.location: This route is located facing the river. If you hike along the east side of the river, this route should be pretty easily visible.

content.description: Sit start matched using the right side of the low flake for hands. Use the various crimpers on the face to make it up to the lip and top out.
content.location: Opposite side of mossy feet boulder, uphill from Mineral Spirits.

content.description: Sit start scrunched on the left low sidepull and right slopey/crimpy thing, then go up. Short but tricky boulder, then the top out is much easier and longer. It is a bit exposed, so a spotter is recommended.
content.location: On the river-facing side of the Fall Silent/Maze Boulder. Short overhang then a long topout. Pretty gorgeous location if you ask me.

content.description: This boulder field up the hill from the river is full of some really amazing and sticky large grain sandstone. There are plenty of tall climbs to be done for those who enjoy them on both slab and overhung.
